dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Silence. Jennifer rises up on her toes and looks out the glass window of the front door. The porch is deserted. Jennifer opens the door slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer looks outside but nothing is there. Just a gentl breeze and the sway of the trees. Satisfied, she walks ou onto the front porch, then down the steps. She hugs herse and shivers, then she returns inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer shuts the front door and locks it. Then she yank on the door, just to make sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks back in grabbing her glass and bottle when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCRAPING sound again, but this time, from UPSTAIRS. Jennifer looks up, hoping that she imagined it. But there is again. She sets the bottle and glass down on the end t next to the couch and then grabs a can of MACE from her p on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks slowly, holding the mace directly in front of h Eventually, Jennifer gets to the top of the stairs. At the far end of the hallway is an open window. A branch from outside scrapes against the windowsill. Jennifer lets out a sigh of relief. She closes the window and heads back downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the mace back in her purse, and then picks up he drink walking to the kitchen when-- BANG! Something smashes into the sliding glass door-- Jennifer SCREAMS dropping the glass. It SHATTERS. With more than a hint of trepidation, Jennifer heads towa THE SIDE DOOR. With all the courage she can muster up, Jennifer unlocks door and steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The side porch light acts as a spotlight, illuminating th culprit -- a lone bird lies motionless on the ground. Jennifer bends down and picks up a small branch from the porch. She gives the bird a small poke... nothing. But he uneasiness is growing. Suddenly... SLAM! She jumps and looks to the shed, the door is open again a swinging. She looks to it thinking, "I shut that already. She moves off the porch and toward the shed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer walks to the shed, it feels longer in the dark. looks around to the tree line, could be something out the an animal, who knows. She reaches the shed and shuts the door again. She search the ground and sees a large stone. She picks up the stone and shoves it against the door. Satisfied, she heads back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer immediately goes over to her table where the lap is set up. She shuffles some papers around when- Something on her laptop screen catches her attention. She leans forward, brow furrowed. ON LAPTOP SCREEN: A picture of Johnny, Stanley, and Andy leering into the laptop's camera. Like a nightmarish phot booth snapshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shot huh? Jennifer shrieks and spins around only to find -- Standing there, right inside the front door, is Johnny. H smiles. Johnny shrugs calmly and continues milling about the room Jennifer spins around, looking for a way out.

dialogues.speaker: ISOYG PINK 10/29/09 22A.
dialogues.text: But Stanley has slipped in through the back door, video camera obnoxiously filming the scene (which will be out t throughout).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile real pretty for the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her voice cracking) Get out of here. Get out of here right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's not very hospitable, is it? Then, the wooden stairs creak under Andy's steps as he wa down -- around his chest is one of Jennifer's bra stretch to the limit. He's twirling a thong panty on his finger. guys get a good laugh at Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of you better get out of here. I called the police. Johnny nods. He looks at her, his gaze mocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called the police? Or you will call the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I called them already. They're on their way right now!

dialogues.text: With what phone? Matthew said you dropped it in the drink. Jennifer doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Stanley) Speaking of.. .where the hell is he? Stanley takes a few steps toward the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew, get your boney ass in here! Shortly after, Matthew shuffles inside. He can't even bri himself to look at Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew here said you didn't pay him for fixity' your sink?

dialogues.text: That is just not true! I tried to. He ran out... (to Matthew) Is that what you said? Matthew winces and starts to snap a rubber band on his wr as Jennifer walks over to her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it-- Johnny cuts her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Let's not worry about that right now. Johnny hops up on the kitchen counter, cutting her off wi his leg. He then picks up the bottle of vodka, takes a sw

dialogues.text: Now what's a pretty little thing like you doing out here all alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Well, I didn't realize you had a boyfriend coming down. We'd better get on outta here. Don't want to ruin date night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Date night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Date night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I think. I think you're lying. There's no boyfriend. No man in his right mind would leave a girl like you all up here on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he's coming. He had to work. I told you he'll be here soon.

dialogues.speaker: ISOYG PINK 10/29/09 25.
dialogues.text: Johnny turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well so will Santi Clause. Andy and Stanley are loving every minute of this. Matthew leans against the wall, his eyes on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .No one wants a phone call at 2 o'clock in the morning. When you're fifteen it's a prank call, when your twenty it's a drunk boyfriend call, but after twenty five, it's usually real bad news. That's how I found out my father died...

dialogues.text: Whose daddy died?

dialogues.text: Can you all please leave me alone?! Meanwhile, Stanley putters around the kitchen, opening an closing the cabinet doors, knocking stuff around. He find pack of rice cakes. He shoves one in his mouth, winces, spits it out.

dialogues.text: Damned cardboard. You eat this shit?

dialogues.text: You should! Do you some good. Andy turns from the desk, strikes a match and flicks it a Jennifer,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, can you just tell me what you want? What do you want? I offered you money. Johnny stubbornly holds out the bottle of vodka. Andy giggles. He finds this quite funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, if you'll leave I'll take a drink. Jennifer studies the bottle and finally accepts it. Drink small sip. They all start booing.

dialogues.text: I took the drink, now you--

dialogues.text: Oh... that's not what this is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha... what?

dialogues.text: You heard me, show Horse. Show me your teeth.

dialogues.text: That's... I'm not going to... please leave.

dialogues.text: (quiet, but firm) Show the teeth... Andy walks over and hands Johnny the small wooden bat he to kill the fish. Johnny smacks it against his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .or lose the teeth.

dialogues.speaker: ISOYG PINK 10/29/09 27A.
dialogues.text: Andy walks back to the couch and flicks another match at Jennifer. She recoils with fear as she reluctantly gives half-smile, her teeth clenched together.

dialogues.text: No. Put two fingers in the side of your mouth. Then two fingers in the other side... and pull. Jennifer looks at Johnny like he's seriously disturbed as Johnny slaps the bat against his hand punctuating his poi Jennifer puts her fingers in her mouth. She pulls her lip away from the gums, spreading them grotesquely. It's completely humiliating. Jennifer stops.

dialogues.text: Now please... I'm begging you... Johnny slides off the counter.

dialogues.text: I'll tell you something sweetheart... know why you ain't got no boyfriend?... 'Cause all them city guys are faggots. Johnny turns to her.

dialogues.text: Why don't you give him a kiss- With terror in her eyes, Jennifer quickly kisses the gun-

dialogues.text: Breathe through your nose. Breathe through your nose like it was your first time. Johnny pulls the gun out just a tiny bit and pushes it ba into her cheek, causing it to bulge out. Naturally, Stanley and Andy both find this hysterical. Especially once Jennifer begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your knees. Jennifer complies. Johnny holds the gun in front of his crotch and again forces it into Jennifer's mouth.

dialogues.text: I...I ddd...don't want to. Johnny walks up to Matthew, angrily, and slaps him across face. He points to Jennifer.

dialogues.text: sh...she likes me... she kissed me. Now shut up and prove it. Matthew holds his fist against his face.

She quickly pulls out a canister of mace - Before the guys even register what is happening Jennifer racing at Stanley -- As he brings the camera down he's met with a spray of mac He clutches his face, screaming in pain -- And like that - Jennifer is out the back door.

dialogues.text: I was assaulted! They broke into the cabin! They had a gun- Jennifer breaks down again.

dialogues.text: John Miller no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF STORCH, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF STORCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No sign of 'em. If they were here, they're gone now. Sheriff Storch makes his way through and walks back into-

dialogues.text: Jennifer follows him and watches as he inspects it closel His eyes fall on the box of liquor bottles.

dialogues.text: With all this?

dialogues.text: I wasn't going to drink it all this weekend. I... I planned on being here for a couple of months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink some tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, they were. They forced me to. He moves away and walks back through the cabin. As he does, he spots the glass shattered on the floor... the nearby THONG and BRA that Andy flung at her. Takes a long hard look at them, then looks back up to Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them, he was up there, went through everything.

dialogues.speaker: ISOYG PINK 10/29/09 35.

dialogues.text: (pointing to the glass) They do this, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I don't care about those things. They shoved a gun in my mouth... Jennifer breaks down again as the Sheriff moves toward he

dialogues.text: Okay, okay Ma'am. It's okay now. Them boys are gone. You're safe now. Jennifer nods to him, still shaken. Storch looks to the l on the back door.  He walks toward the back door and turns the dead bolt bac and forth.

dialogues.text: Yes. Of course.

dialogues.text: Sheriff Storch steps onto the porch. Jennifer follows. Sheriff Storch looks down and sees the dead bird at his f He pokes it with the barrel of his shotgun.

dialogues.text: How long you been here?

dialogues.text: Anything strange happen before this? You have a run in with any of these guys?

dialogues.text: No. Not really. I stopped for gas and directions.

dialogues.text: Ma'am, is this your marijuana cigarette?  Suddenly, Jennifer realizes that simple possession might go over in this small town like it does in Manhattan.

dialogues.text: Uh... n...no. The men probably left it. Sheriff Storch walks over to Jennifer until he's standing directly in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF STORCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This ain't the big city. Sheriff Storch stands uncomfortably close. Slowly, he wal closer up to Jennifer's face, stares into her eyelids. Pu down one of them. Then the other. Then his gaze falls dow to her chest... her ample cleavage. His stare lingers a b too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I swear. I didn't make it up. I may have smoked a joint, but- Sheriff Storch lifts his walkie-talkie to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the walkie-talkie) This is Sheriff Storch. I'm at the Mockingbird Cabin. I gonna need some backup. The words out of the Sheriff's mouth seem almost surreal.

dialogues.text: Backup? What could you possibly need back up for? I'm the victim. Sheriff Storch holds up his hand, cutting her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am. You've been drinking and smoking marijuana, and you got enough alcohol here to put our whole town three sheets to the wind. You're running around in your nighty at the crack of dawn... You need to see this from my point of view.

dialogues.text: What?! They were here! They assaulted me! You've got to believe me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to get to the bottom of it. You're making serious accusations bout' boys I've know since they was kids, and you  haven't been all together truthful now have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now please, against the wall. Angry and ashamed, Jennifer walks over and places her pal against the wall, her legs pressed tightly together. Sheriff Storch inches up behind her. He taps the inside o her thigh with his shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF STORCH, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: They do this to you? Jennifer is too terrified to speak. Sheriff Storch then slips the shotgun down between her legs.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF STORCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I asked you a question. Jennifer trembles with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show him those teeth, Show Horse.

dialogues.text: Sheriff Storch brings the gun back up to her mouth - slid it under Jennifer's top lip and pushes it up.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF STORCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said, whinny. Jennifer makes a pathetic SOUND. Not really a whinny, but more of a half-cry, half-snort. Naturally, this amuses An and Stanley -- who is, of course, filming it -- to no end

dialogues.text: Oh, man. Oh, man.

The slightest scratch across his lip. Sheriff Storch turns beet red. He backhands her across th face sending her back down to the floor. A thin line of blood flows from her nose. The Sheriff looks over to John licks his lip and nods his head.

dialogues.text: Think you outta tame this little mare of yours. Johnny takes the Sheriff's lead.

dialogues.text: Alright, come on, Show Horse. Get up. Or you won't get a sugar cube. Jennifer struggles to her feet. She stands in front of th defenseless. Johnny grabs her hair and pulls her head far back. She lets out a half-moan.

dialogues.text: Take off your clothes. We're about to pop your cherry. Matthew shakes his head. His wrist is not beat red from t rubber bands. Snap!

dialogues.text: I'm not asking, now cut that rubber band shit faggot.

dialogues.text: Come on, Matthew. You want to talk the talk, then walk the walk, you virgin. Johnny flicks open a pocket knife. He tickles Jennifer's bottom lip with the blade, then gently runs it down her c past her neck, and between her breasts, just before stopp at the waistband, then he slices the waistband of her pan her pants drop to the floor.

dialogues.text: Do it now. Or else I slice her chin to cunt. This gets Matthew moving. A few seconds later, he's in hi boxer shorts, with his hands crossed in front of his crot Johnny grabs him and throws him up against the wall. He t yanks his boxers down. Matthew immediately covers up his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
